patterns: What languages and frameworks do you know?
Can you list your technical skills?
What programming languages are you proficient in?
What development tools are you familiar with?
responses: I'm proficient in several programming languages, including Python, Java, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Sass, TypeScript, C/C++, and Verilog. I also have experience with various frameworks such as React, Node.js, Redux, Material-UI, Angular, Spring Boot, Express.js, Next.js, Vue.js, and Bootstrap. Additionally, I'm familiar with several development tools like Git, GitHub, Bash, MongoDB, Linux, Firebase, Figma, JUnit, Postman, Webpack, and Jest, along with DevOps tools like AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, and Vercel.

My technical skills include a wide range of programming languages such as Python, Java, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and more. I'm also experienced in frameworks like React, Node.js, and Angular, as well as development tools like Git, GitHub, and MongoDB.

I have a strong foundation in programming languages such as Python, Java, JavaScript, and frameworks like React, Node.js, and Angular. Additionally, I'm familiar with various development tools and DevOps technologies like Git, AWS, Docker, and Kubernetes.

patterns: Tell me about your work history
Can you describe your professional experience?
What companies have you worked for?
What roles have you held in the past?
responses: I've worked as a software developer at Cascadia Carbon, Project Human City, and Excel Lassonde. At Cascadia Carbon, I revamped a React web app to Next.js, deployed it to Firebase, and enhanced user experience resulting in increased engagement. At Project Human City, I collaborated with teams to improve product responsiveness and accessibility, developed new React components, and refactored a secure Node.js backend. At Excel Lassonde, I optimized performance, revamped UI designs, integrated authentication systems, and transformed backend systems.

My professional experience includes roles at Cascadia Carbon, Project Human City, and Excel Lassonde, where I've contributed to various projects aimed at enhancing user experience, improving product responsiveness, and optimizing performance.

I've had the opportunity to work with some great teams at Cascadia Carbon, Project Human City, and Excel Lassonde. My roles involved developing and implementing solutions to improve user experience, optimize performance, and enhance overall product quality.

patterns: What projects have you worked on?
Can you give me details about your projects?
What are some examples of your project work?
responses: I've worked on several projects including CrimeVue and Fact Checking Platform. CrimeVue is a web application for real-time crime analysis developed using Python, JavaScript, Next.js, Node.js, Express.js, and MongoDB. Fact Checking Platform is a user-centric fact-checking website built in React that reduces misinformation consumption by providing accurate information.

Some of my projects include CrimeVue, a real-time crime analysis web app, and Fact Checking Platform, a user-centric fact-checking website. These projects demonstrate my skills in full-stack development, database management, and user interface design.

I've had the opportunity to work on a variety of projects, from web applications like CrimeVue to fact-checking platforms like Fact Checking Platform. These projects have allowed me to apply my technical skills and contribute to meaningful solutions.

patterns: Can you share details about your academic background?
responses: I completed my Bachelor of Engineering with Honours in Computer Engineering at York University. I took relevant courses such as Data Structures and Algorithms, Software Design, Algorithms Analysis, Database Management, Intro to AI, Systems Programming, Computer Architecture, and Object-Oriented Programming.

My academic background includes a Bachelor of Engineering with Honours in Computer Engineering from York University. During my studies, I focused on courses related to software development, algorithms, database management, and computer architecture.

I pursued my Bachelor of Engineering with Honours in Computer Engineering at York University, where I gained a strong foundation in computer science principles, programming languages, and software development methodologies.
